growing.soil: Deep, fertile, well-drained; frost resistant soils preferred (high clay or sand); hilltop or slope ideal

planting.spacing: 10 (dwarf) - 20 feet apart, with at least one other apple tree variety within 60 feet for pollination
companion: At least one other apple species

pruning: Classic bush tree pruning during winter
Remove weak, diseased, or injured branches
Remove inward, crossing, or upright branches
Remove one branch from a fork of two

ecologicalInfo.notes: Require another variety of apple nearby for effective pollination
